function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Informal signs conveying regret, gratitude, and well-wishes may lead to increased foot traffic and close interactions, posing a risk of contagious disease spread.","Impact":"Increased risk of contagious disease transmission due to close interactions and foot traffic.","Mitigation":"Use digital signs, implement social distancing measures, and provide hand sanitizing stations to reduce close interactions and potential spread of contagious diseases.","Technologies":"Digital signage, social distancing monitoring technology, hand sanitizing stations","People":"Customers, employees, and community members","Owner":"Business owners, local government, and community leaders"},{"Description":"Informal signs conveying facts about expected behavior may not encourage compliance with public health guidelines, increasing the risk of contagious disease spread.","Impact":"Reduced compliance with public health guidelines, leading to increased risk of contagious disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Provide clear and empathetic messaging, enforce policies, and use signage to encourage safe behaviors.","Technologies":"Public health messaging software, enforcement technology, behavior change communication tools","People":"Employees, customers, and community members","Owner":"Business owners, management teams, and public health authorities"},{"Description":"Introduction of non-local retail brands and their signage may not align with the neighborhood's nature, potentially impacting the sense of community and local identity.","Impact":"Loss of community identity and cohesion, leading to potential social and economic impacts.","Mitigation":"Encourage local brand representation, preserve local culture, and promote community engagement through collaborative signage and branding efforts.","Technologies":"Community engagement platforms, local branding initiatives, collaborative signage design tools","People":"Local residents, business owners, and community organizations","Owner":"Local government, neighborhood associations, and business alliances"}]}
